text: Beta - catenin accumulation and mutation of the CTNNB1 gene in hepatoblastoma .

title: NA
text: Hepatoblastoma is a rare malignant tumor of the liver that occurs in children at an average age of 2 to 3 years .

title: NA
text: Epidemiologic studies have shown an increased frequency of this tumor type in families affected by adenomatous polyposis coli .

title: NA
text: In addition to the epidemiologic data , molecular genetic studies suggest that inactivation of the APC tumor suppressor may be involved in hepatoblastoma tumorigenesis .

title: NA
text: A major function of APC is the downregulation of beta - catenin , a transcription - activating protein with oncogenic potential .

title: NA
text: In an ongoing immunohistochemical study of beta - catenin expression in sporadic cases of tumor types that are associated with adenomatous polyposis coli , we observed increased beta - catenin levels in the cytoplasm and in the nuclei of three investigated hepatoblastomas .

title: NA
text: Sequencing of exon 3 of the beta - catenin gene ( CTNNB1 ) revealed an activating mutation in one of the tumor samples .

title: NA
text: Our data indicate for the first time that beta - catenin accumulation may play a role in the development of hepatoblastoma and that activating mutations of the beta - catenin gene may substitute biallelic APC inactivation in this tumor type .

text: Decrease in GTP cyclohydrolase I gene expression caused by inactivation of one allele in hereditary progressive dystonia with marked diurnal fluctuation .

title: NA
text: Hereditary progressive dystonia with marked diurnal fluctuation ( HPD ; dopa - responsive dystonia , DRD ) have been recently found to be caused by a genetic defect in the GTP cyclohydrolase I ( GCH1 ) gene .

title: NA
text: In this study , we quantified the mRNA level of GCH1 in phytohemagglutinin ( PHA ) - stimulated mononuclear blood cells from one Japanese family that do not have a mutation in the coding region or splice junctions of the gene .

title: NA
text: The results showed that the amounts of the GCH1 mRNA were decreased to about 40 % of the normal level in both patients and carriers .

title: NA
text: In addition , we found that the GCH1 mRNA was transcribed from only one allele , indicating that the other allele was in an inactive state .

title: NA
text: These results suggest that some novel mutations should exist on one of the alleles in some unknown region of the GCH1 gene , and may decrease the GCH1 mRNA causing the HPD / DRD symptoms . .

text: Sulfate transport is not impaired in pendred syndrome thyrocytes .

title: NA
text: Pendred syndrome is the most common form of syndromic deafness , characterized by dyshormonogenic goiter associated with sensory - neural deafness .

title: NA
text: The gene responsible for the disease ( PDS ) has been cloned , but its function is as yet unknown and the connection between thyroid goiter and sensory - neural deafness remains an enigma .

title: NA
text: PDS codes for a novel protein , pendrin , which is closely related to a number of sufate transporters .

title: NA
text: Mechanisms by which abnormal sulfate transport could deleteriously affect iodide organification have been proposed .

title: NA
text: We tested sulfate transport in thyrocytes obtained from Pendred syndrome patients and found that it was not defective .

title: NA
text: This suggests that pendrin in fact may not be a sulfate transporter , and emphasizes the importance of functional studies on this novel protein . .

text: Small deletions in the type II collagen triple helix produce kniest dysplasia .

title: NA
text: Kniest dysplasia is a moderately severe type II collagenopathy , characterized by short trunk and limbs , kyphoscoliosis , midface hypoplasia , severe myopia , and hearing loss .

title: NA
text: Mutations in the gene that encodes type II collagen ( COL2A1 ) , the predominant protein of cartilage , have been identified in a number of individuals with Kniest dysplasia .

title: NA
text: All but two of these previously described mutations cause in - frame deletions in type II collagen , either by small deletions in the gene or splice site alterations .

title: NA
text: Furthermore , all but one of these mutations is located between exons 12 and 24 in the COL2A1 gene .

title: NA
text: We used heteroduplex analysis to identify sequence anomalies in five individuals with Kniest dysplasia .

title: NA
text: Sequencing of the index patients genomic DNA identified four new dominant mutations in COL2A1 that result in Kniest dysplasia a 21 - bp deletion in exon 16 , an 18 - bp deletion in exon 19 , and 4 - bp deletions in the splice donor sites of introns 14 and 20 .

title: NA
text: A previously described 28 - bp deletion at the COL2A1 exon 12 - intron 12 junction , deleting the splice donor site , was identified in the fifth case .

title: NA
text: The latter three mutations are predicted to result in exon skipping in the mRNA encoded from the mutant allele .

title: NA
text: These data suggest that Kniest dysplasia results from shorter type II collagen monomers , and support the hypothesis that alteration of a specific COL2A1 domain , which may span from exons 12 to 24 , leads to the Kniest dysplasia phenotype . .

text: Classical galactosemia and mutations at the galactose - 1 - phosphate uridyl transferase ( GALT ) gene .

title: NA
text: Classical galactosemia is caused by a deficiency in activity of the enzyme galactose - 1 - phosphate uridyl transferase ( GALT ) , which , in turn , is caused by mutations at the GALT gene .

title: NA
text: The disorder exhibits considerable allelic heterogeneity and , at the end of 1998 , more than 150 different base changes were recorded in 24 different populations and ethnic groups in 15 countries worldwide .

title: NA
text: The mutations most frequently cited are Q188R , K285N , S135L , and N314D .

title: NA
text: Q188R is the most common mutation in European populations or in those predominantly of European descent .

title: NA
text: Overall , it accounts for 60 - 70 % of mutant chromosomes , but there are significant differences in its relative frequency in individual populations .

title: NA
text: Individuals homoallelic for Q188R tend to have a severe phenotype and this is in keeping with the virtually complete loss of enzyme activity observed in in vitro expression systems .

title: NA
text: Globally , K285N is rarer , but in many European populations it can be found on 25 - 40 % of mutant chromosomes .

title: NA
text: It is invariably associated with a severe phenotype .

title: NA
text: S135L is found almost exclusively in African Americans .

title: NA
text: In vitro expression results are discrepant , but some individuals carrying S135L appear to exhibit GALT activity in some tissues .

title: NA
text: Duarte 1 ( or Los Angeles ) and Duarte 2 ( or Duarte ) variants carry the same amino acid substitution , N314D , even though D1 is associated with increased erythrocyte GALT activity and D2 with reduced activity .

title: NA
text: N314D is in linkage disequilibrium with other base changes that differ on the D1 and D2 alleles .

title: NA
text: N314D does not impair GALT activity in in vitro expression systems .

title: NA
text: However , there are differences in the abundance of GALT protein in lymphoblastoid cells lines from D2 and D1 individuals .

title: NA
text: It is unclear whether the specific molecular changes that distinguish the D1 and D2 alleles account for the different activities .

title: NA
text: The considerable genetic heterogeneity documented to date undoubtedly contributes to the phenotypic heterogeneity that is observed in galactosemia .

title: NA
text: The additional effects of nonallelic variation and other constitutional factors on phenotypic variability remain to be elucidated . .

text: Mutations of the VHL gene in sporadic renal cell carcinoma : definition of a risk factor for VHL patients to develop an RCC .

title: NA
text: To investigate the nature of somatic von Hippel - Lindau ( VHL ) mutations , we analyzed 173 primary sporadic human renal cell carcinomas for mutations of the VHL tumor suppressor gene , using polymerase chain reaction ( PCR ) and single - strand conformational polymorphism analysis ( SSCP ) of DNA .

title: NA
text: We detected abnormal SSCP pattern in 73 samples .

title: NA
text: After sequencing , we identified microdeletions in 58 % of cases , microinsertions in 17 % , nonsense mutations in 8 % , and missense mutations in 17 % .

title: NA
text: Among these mutations , 50 % correspond to new mutations .

title: NA
text: VHL mutations were found only in the nonpapillary renal cell carcinoma ( RCC ) subtype , as previously reported .

title: NA
text: To compare somatic and germline mutations , we used the VHL database , which includes 507 mutations .

title: NA
text: The study of mutational events revealed a significant difference between somatic and germline mutations with mutations leading to truncated proteins observed in 78 % of somatic mutations vs only 37 % in germline mutations ( P < 0 . 001 ) .

title: NA
text: We postulated that a specific pattern of VHL mutations is associated with sporadic RCC .

title: NA
text: This pattern corresponds to mutations leading mainly to truncated proteins with few specific missense mutations .

title: NA
text: We then analyzed the occurrence of RCC in VHL families , based on the nature of mutations .

title: NA
text: We observed RCC in at least one member of the VHL families in 77 % of cases with mutations leading to truncated proteins versus 55 % in cases with missense mutations ( P < 0 . 05 ) .

title: NA
text: Thus , mutations resulting in truncated proteins may lead to a higher risk of RCC in VHL patients

text: Defective CTLA - 4 cycling pathway in Chediak - Higashi syndrome : a possible mechanism for deregulation of T lymphocyte activation .

title: NA
text: Cytotoxic T lymphocyte - associated antigen 4 ( CTLA - 4 , also known as CD152 ) has been shown to play a major role in the regulation of T cell activation .

title: NA
text: Its membrane expression is highly regulated by endocytosis and trafficking through the secretory lysosome pathway .

title: NA
text: Chediak - Higashi syndrome ( CHS ) is an inherited disorder caused by mutations in the lysosomal trafficking regulator gene , LYST .

title: NA
text: It results in defective membrane targeting of the proteins present in secretory lysosomes , and it is associated with a variety of features , including a lymphoproliferative syndrome with hemophagocytosis .

title: NA
text: The murine equivalent of CHS , beige mice , present similar characteristics but do not develop the lymphoproliferative syndrome .

title: NA
text: We show herein that CTLA - 4 is present in enlarged , abnormal vesicles in CHS T cells and is not properly expressed at the cell surface after T cell activation , whereas its surface expression is not impaired .

title: NA
text: It is therefore proposed that the defective surface expression of CTLA - 4 by CHS T cells is involved in the generation of lymphoproliferative disease .

title: NA
text: This observation may provide insight into the role of CTLA - 4 in humans . .

text: Proteolipoprotein gene analysis in 82 patients with sporadic Pelizaeus - Merzbacher Disease : duplications , the major cause of the disease , originate more frequently in male germ cells , but point mutations do not .

title: NA
text: The Clinical European Network on Brain Dysmyelinating Disease .

title: NA
text: Pelizaeus - Merzbacher Disease ( PMD ) is an X - linked developmental defect of myelination affecting the central nervous system and segregating with the proteolipoprotein ( PLP ) locus .

title: NA
text: Investigating 82 strictly selected sporadic cases of PMD , we found PLP mutations in 77 % ; complete PLP - gene duplications were the most frequent abnormality ( 62 % ) , whereas point mutations in coding or splice - site regions of the gene were involved less frequently ( 38 % ) .

title: NA
text: We analyzed the maternal status of 56 cases to determine the origin of both types of PLP mutation , since this is relevant to genetic counseling .

title: NA
text: In the 22 point mutations , 68 % of mothers were heterozygous for the mutation , a value identical to the two - thirds of carrier mothers that would be expected if there were an equal mutation rate in male and female germ cells .

title: NA
text: In sharp contrast , among the 34 duplicated cases , 91 % of mothers were carriers , a value significantly ( chi2 = 9 . 20 , P < . 01 ) in favor of a male bias , with an estimation of the male / female mutation frequency ( k ) of 9 .

title: NA
text: Moreover , we observed the occurrence of de novo mutations between parental and grandparental generations in 17 three - generation families , which allowed a direct estimation of the k value ( k = 11 ) .

title: NA
text: Again , a significant male mutation imbalance was observed only for the duplications .

text: Chromosome breakage in the Prader - Willi and Angelman syndromes involves recombination between large , transcribed repeats at proximal and distal breakpoints .

title: NA
text: Prader - Willi syndrome ( PWS ) and Angelman syndrome ( AS ) are distinct neurobehavioral disorders that most often arise from a 4 - Mb deletion of chromosome 15q11 - q13 during paternal or maternal gametogenesis , respectively .

title: NA
text: At a de novo frequency of approximately .

title: NA
text: 67 - 1 / 10 , 000 births , these deletions represent a common structural chromosome change in the human genome .

title: NA
text: To elucidate the mechanism underlying these events , we characterized the regions that contain two proximal breakpoint clusters and a distal cluster .

title: NA
text: Novel DNA sequences potentially associated with the breakpoints were positionally cloned from YACs within or near these regions .

title: NA
text: Analyses of rodent - human somatic - cell hybrids , YAC contigs , and FISH of normal or rearranged chromosomes 15 identified duplicated sequences ( the END repeats ) at or near the breakpoints .

title: NA
text: The END - repeat units are derived from large genomic duplications of a novel gene ( HERC2 ) , many copies of which are transcriptionally active in germline tissues .

title: NA
text: One of five PWS / AS patients analyzed to date has an identifiable , rearranged HERC2 transcript derived from the deletion event .

title: NA
text: We postulate that the END repeats flanking 15q11 - q13 mediate homologous recombination resulting in deletion .

title: NA
text: Furthermore , we propose that active transcription of these repeats in male and female germ cells may facilitate the homologous recombination process .

text: Linkage analysis in a large Brazilian family with van der Woude syndrome suggests the existence of a susceptibility locus for cleft palate at 17p11 . 2 - 11 . 1 .

title: NA
text: van der Woude syndrome ( VWS ) , which has been mapped to 1q32 - 41 , is characterized by pits and / or sinuses of the lower lip , cleft lip / palate ( CL / P ) , cleft palate ( CP ) , bifid uvula , and hypodontia ( H ) .

title: NA
text: The expression of VWS , which has incomplete penetrance , is highly variable .

title: NA
text: Both the occurrence of CL / P and CP within the same genealogy and a recurrence risk < 40 % for CP among descendants with VWS have suggested that the development of clefts in this syndrome is influenced by modifying genes at other loci .

title: NA
text: To test this hypothesis , we have conducted linkage analysis in a large Brazilian kindred with VWS , considering as affected the individuals with CP , regardless of whether it is associated with other clinical signs of VWS .

title: NA
text: Our results suggest that a gene at 17p11 .

title: NA
text: 1 , together with the VWS gene at 1p32 - 41 , enhances the probability of CP in an individual carrying the two at - risk genes .

title: NA
text: If this hypothesis is confirmed in other VWS pedigrees , it will represent one of the first examples of a gene , mapped through linkage analysis , which modifies the expression of a major gene .

text: New mutations , polymorphisms , and rare variants in the ATM gene detected by a novel SSCP strategy .

title: NA
text: The gene for ataxia - telangiectasia , ATM , spans about 150 kb of genomic DNA .

title: NA
text: ATM mutations are found along the entire gene , with no evidence of a mutational hot spot .

title: NA
text: Using DNA as the starting material , we screened the ATM gene in 92 A - T patients , using an optimized single - strand conformation polymorphism ( SSCP ) technique that detected all previously known mutations in the polymerase chain reaction ( PCR ) segments being analyzed .

title: NA
text: To expedite screening , we sequentially loaded the SSCP gels with three different sets of PCR products that were pretested to avoid overlapping patterns .

title: NA
text: Many of the DNA changes we detected were intragenic polymorphisms .

title: NA
text: Of an expected 177 unknown mutations , we detected approximately 70 % , mostly protein truncating mutations ( that would have been detectable by protein truncation testing if RNA starting material had been available ) .

title: NA
text: Mutations have now been defined for every exon of the ATM gene .

title: NA
text: Herein , we present 35 new mutations and 34 new intragenic polymorphisms or rare variants within the ATM gene .

text: A novel frameshift mutation in the McLeod syndrome gene in a Japanese family .

title: NA
text: We report a novel mutation in the XK gene ( XK ) in a Japanese patient with McLeod syndrome .

title: NA
text: A 50 - year - old man showed progressive muscular atrophy , choreic movement , elevated level of serum creatinine kinase , and acanthocytosis .

title: NA
text: The expression level of all the Kell antigens in erythrocyte was decreased and molecular analysis revealed a single - base ( T ) deletion at the nucleotide position 1095 in XK .

title: NA
text: This deletion caused a frameshift in translation , leading to a premature stop codon at the amino acid position 408 .

title: NA
text: We conclude this single - base deletion causes defective Kx protein , which is responsible for the McLeod phenotype in this patient . .

text: Association of BRCA1 with the hRad50 - hMre11 - p95 complex and the DNA damage response .

title: NA
text: BRCA1 encodes a tumor suppressor that is mutated in familial breast and ovarian cancers .

title: NA
text: Here , it is shown that BRCA1 interacts in vitro and in vivo with hRad50 , which forms a complex with hMre11 and p95 / nibrin .

title: NA
text: Upon irradiation , BRCA1 was detected in discrete foci in the nucleus , which colocalize with hRad50 .

title: NA
text: Formation of irradiation - induced foci positive for BRCA1 , hRad50 , hMre11 , or p95 was dramatically reduced in HCC / 1937 breast cancer cells carrying a homozygous mutation in BRCA1 but was restored by transfection of wild - type BRCA1 .

title: NA
text: Ectopic expression of wild - type , but not mutated , BRCA1 in these cells rendered them less sensitive to the DNA damage agent , methyl methanesulfonate .

title: NA
text: These data suggest that BRCA1 is important for the cellular responses to DNA damage that are mediated by the hRad50 - hMre11 - p95 complex . .

text: Relationship among genotype , biochemical phenotype , and cognitive performance in females with phenylalanine hydroxylase deficiency : report from the Maternal Phenylketonuria Collaborative Study .

title: NA
text: OBJECTIVE To examine the relationship of phenylalanine hydroxylase ( PAH ) genotypes to biochemical phenotype and cognitive development in maternal phenylketonuria ( PKU ) .

title: NA
text: METHODOLOGY PAH gene mutations were examined in 222 hyperphenylalaninemic females enrolled in the Maternal PKU Collaborative Study ( MPKUCS ) .

title: NA
text: A total of 84 different mutations were detected , and complete genotype was obtained in 199 individuals .

title: NA
text: Based on previous knowledge about mutation - phenotype associations , 78 of the mutations could be assigned to one of four classes of severity ( severe PKU , moderate PKU , mild PKU , and mild hyperphenylalaninemia [ MHP ] ) .

title: NA
text: Then , 189 MPKUCS subjects were grouped according to the various combinations of mutation classifications .

title: NA
text: The sample sizes were large enough for statistical testing in four groups with at least one mutation that completely abolishes enzyme activity .

title: NA
text: These patients are considered functionally hemizygous .

title: NA
text: RESULTS The biochemical phenotype predicted from the genotype in functionally hemizygous patients was related significantly to the assigned phenylalanine level .

title: NA
text: Cognitive performance ( IQ ) was also significantly related to genotype .

title: NA
text: The IQ of PAH - deficient mothers with a severe PKU mutation in combination with a MHP mutation or a mild PKU mutation was 99 and 96 , respectively , whereas the IQ of PKU mothers with two severe PKU mutations or with one severe and one moderate PKU mutation was 83 and 84 , respectively .

title: NA
text: Of the patients with PKU , 92 % had been treated during childhood .

title: NA
text: Those who were untreated or treated late had lower than average IQ scores for their group of mutation combinations .

title: NA
text: Females with moderate or mild PKU who were treated early and treated for > 6 years showed IQ scores 10 points above average for their group .

title: NA
text: CONCLUSIONS The reproductive outcome in maternal phenylketonuria is dependent on prenatal metabolic control and postnatal environmental circumstances .

title: NA
text: Both factors depend on the intellectual resources of the mother with PKU .

title: NA
text: The significant relationship among genotype , biochemical phenotype , and cognitive performance observed in the present study is of importance for the development of an optimal strategy for future treatment of females with PKU who plan pregnancy . .

text: Spinal xanthomatosis : a variant of cerebrotendinous xanthomatosis .

title: NA
text: We describe seven Dutch patients from six families with a slowly progressive , mainly spinal cord syndrome that remained for many years the sole expression of cerebrotendinous xanthomatosis ( CTX ) .

title: NA
text: MRI demonstrated white matter abnormalities in the lateral and dorsal columns of the spinal cord .

title: NA
text: Post - mortem examination of one of the patients showed extensive myelin loss in these columns .

title: NA
text: An array of genotypes was found in these patients .

title: NA
text: We conclude that spinal xanthomatosis is a clinical and radiological separate entity of CTX that should be included in the differential diagnosis of chronic myelopathy . .

text: A transgene insertion creating a heritable chromosome deletion mouse model of Prader - Willi and angelman syndromes .

title: NA
text: Prader - Willi syndrome ( PWS ) and Angelman syndrome ( AS ) result from the loss of function of imprinted genes in human chromosome 15q11 - q13 .

title: NA
text: The central part of mouse chromosome 7 is homologous to human 15q11 - q13 , with conservation of both gene order and imprinted features .

title: NA
text: We report here the characterization of a transgene insertion ( Epstein - Barr virus Latent Membrane Protein 2A , LMP2A ) into mouse chromosome 7C , which has resulted in mouse models for PWS and AS dependent on the sex of the transmitting parent .

title: NA
text: Epigenotype ( allelic expression and DNA methylation ) and fluorescence in situ hybridization analyses indicate that the transgene - induced mutation has generated a complete deletion of the PWS / AS - homologous region but has not deleted flanking loci .

title: NA
text: Because the intact chromosome 7 , opposite the deleted homolog , maintains the correct imprint in somatic cells of PWS and AS mice and establishes the correct imprint in male and female germ cells of AS mice , homologous association and replication asynchrony are not part of the imprinting mechanism .

title: NA
text: This heritable - deletion mouse model will be particularly useful for the identification of the etiological genes and mechanisms , phenotypic basis , and investigation of therapeutic approaches for PWS . .

title: NA
text: van der Woude syndrome ( vWS , MIM 119300 ) is a rare autosomal dominant clefting condition with cardinal features of mucous cysts ( lower - lip pits ) and clefts to the lip and / or palate .

title: NA
text: The vWS gene has been assigned to a locus in 1q32 - q41 by linkage analysis and physical mapping .

title: NA
text: We have investigated 5 novel vWS families through probands attended for cleft lip and / or palate repair at the Department of Maxillofacial Surgery of Hopital Trousseau , Paris , in order to tentatively refine the genetic map of the vWS region in 1q32 - q41 and possibly identify unlinked pedigrees .

text: Null mutation of the murine ATP7B ( Wilson disease ) gene results in intracellular copper accumulation and late - onset hepatic nodular transformation .

title: NA
text: The Atp7b protein is a copper - transporting ATPase expressed predominantly in the liver and to a lesser extent in most other tissues .

title: NA
text: Mutations in the ATP7B gene lead to Wilson disease , a copper toxicity disorder characterized by dramatic build - up of intracellular hepatic copper with subsequent hepatic and neuro - logical abnormalities .

title: NA
text: Using homologous recombination to disrupt the normal translation of ATP7B , we have generated a strain of mice that are homozygous mutants ( null ) for the Wilson disease gene .

title: NA
text: The ATP7B null mice display a gradual accumulation of hepatic copper that increases to a level 60 - fold greater than normal by 5 months of age .

title: NA
text: An increase in copper concentration was also observed in the kidney , brain , placenta and lactating mammary glands of homo - zygous mutants , although milk from the mutant glands was copper deficient .

title: NA
text: Morphological abnormalities resembling cirrhosis developed in the majority of the livers from homozygous mutants older than 7 months of age .

title: NA
text: Progeny of the homozygous mutant females demonstrated neurological abnormalities and growth retardation characteristic of copper deficiency .

title: NA
text: Copper concentration in the livers of the newborn homozygous null mutants was decreased dramatically .

title: NA
text: In summary , inactivation of the murine ATP7B gene produces a form of cirrhotic liver disease that resembles Wilson disease in humans and the toxic milk phenotype in the mouse . .

text: French Machado - Joseph disease patients do not exhibit gametic segregation distortion : a sperm typing analysis .

title: NA
text: Segregation distortion has been reported to occur in a number of the trinucleotide repeat disorders .

title: NA
text: On the basis of a sperm typing study performed in patients of Japanese descent with Machado - Joseph disease ( MJD ) , it was reported that disease alleles are preferentially transmitted during meiosis .

title: NA
text: We performed a sperm typing study of five MJD patients of French descent and analysis of the pooled data shows a ratio of mutant to normal alleles of 379 436 ( 46 . 5 53 . 5 % ) , which does not support meiotic segregation distortion .

title: NA
text: To confirm these results , sperm typing analysis was also performed using a polymorphic marker , D14S1050 , closely linked to the MJD1 gene .

title: NA
text: Among 910 sperm analyzed , the allele linked to the disease chromosome was detected in 50 .

title: NA
text: 3 % of the samples and the allele linked to the normal chromosome was found in 49 .

title: NA
text: 6 % of the sperm .

title: NA
text: The difference in frequency of these two alleles is not significant ( P = 0 . 8423 ) .

title: NA
text: Likelihood - based analysis of segregation distortion in the single sperm data using the SPERMSEG program also showed no support for segregation distortion at the gamete level in this patient population .

title: NA
text: The previous report on the Japanese patients also suggested that disease allele stability may be influenced by a trans effect of an intragenic polymorphism ( 987 G / C ) in the wild - type allele .

title: NA
text: All of the French patients were heterozygous for this polymorphism .

title: NA
text: However , analysis of the variance in repeat number in sperm from the French MJD patients overlapped significantly with the variance in repeat number observed in the C / C homozygous Japanese patients .

text: Missense mutation in the alternative splice region of the PAX6 gene in eye anomalies .

title: NA
text: The PAX6 gene is involved in ocular morphogenesis , and PAX6 mutations have been detected in various types of ocular anomalies , including aniridia , Peters anomaly , corneal dystrophy , congenital cataract , and foveal hypoplasia .

title: NA
text: The gene encodes a transcriptional regulator that recognizes target genes through its paired - type DNA - binding domain .

title: NA
text: The paired domain is composed of two distinct DNA - binding subdomains , the N - terminal subdomain ( NTS ) and the C - terminal subdomain ( CTS ) , which bind respective consensus DNA sequences .

title: NA
text: The human PAX6 gene produces two alternative splice isoforms that have the distinct structure of the paired domain .

title: NA
text: The insertion , into the NTS , of 14 additional amino acids encoded by exon 5a abolishes the DNA - binding activity of the NTS and unmasks the DNA - binding ability of the CTS .

title: NA
text: Thus , exon 5a appears to function as a molecular switch that specifies target genes .

title: NA
text: We ascertained a novel missense mutation in four pedigrees with Peters anomaly , congenital cataract , Axenfeldt anomaly , and / or foveal hypoplasia , which , to our knowledge , is the first mutation identified in the splice - variant region .

title: NA
text: A T - - > A transition at the 20th nucleotide position of exon 5a results in a Val - - > Asp ( GTC - - > GAC ) substitution at the 7th codon of the alternative splice region .

title: NA
text: Functional analyses demonstrated that the V54D mutation slightly increased NTS binding and decreased CTS transactivation activity to almost half . .

text: Penetrances of BRCA1 1675delA and 1135insA with respect to breast cancer and ovarian cancer .

title: NA
text: For genetic counseling and predictive testing in families with inherited breast - ovarian cancer , penetrances and expressions of the underlying mutations should be known .

title: NA
text: We have previously reported two BRCA1 founder mutations in the Norwegian population .

title: NA
text: Index cases for the present study were found two different ways through a series of consecutive ovarian cancers ( n = 16 ) and through our family cancer clinic ( n = 14 ) .

title: NA
text: Altogether , 20 of the patients had BRCA1 1675delA , and 10 had 1135insA .

title: NA
text: Their relatives were described with respect to absence / presence of breast and / or ovarian cancer .

title: NA
text: Of 133 living female relatives , 83 ( 62 % ) were tested for the presence of a mutation .

title: NA
text: No difference , in penetrance and expression , between the two mutations were found , whereas differences according to method of ascertainment were seen .

title: NA
text: The overall findings were that disease started to occur at age 30 years and that by age 50 years 48 % of the mutation - carrying women had experienced breast and / or ovarian cancer .

title: NA
text: More ovarian cancers than breast cancers were recorded .

title: NA
text: Both penetrance and expression ( breast cancer vs . ovarian cancer ) were different from those in reports of the Ashkenazi founder mutations .

title: NA
text: Whether the reported differences reflect true differences and / or methodological problems is discussed .

title: NA
text: An observed excess of mutation carriers could not be accounted for by methodological problems ; possible explanations were a " true " low penetrance or preferential segregation . .

text: The dermatofibrosarcoma protuberans - associated collagen type Ialpha1 / platelet - derived growth factor ( PDGF ) B - chain fusion gene generates a transforming protein that is processed to functional PDGF - BB .

title: NA
text: Dermatofibrosarcoma protuberans ( DFSP ) displays chromosomal rearrangements involving chromosome 17 and 22 , which fuse the collagen type Ialpha1 ( COLIA1 ) gene to the platelet - derived growth factor ( PDGF ) B - chain ( PDGFB ) gene .

title: NA
text: To characterize the functional and structural properties of the COLIA1 / PDGFB fusion protein , we generated a stable NIH3T3 cell line that contained a tumor - derived chimeric gene resulting from a COIA1 intron 7 - PDGFB intron 1 fusion .

title: NA
text: Expression of the fusion protein led to morphological transformation and increased growth rate of these cells .

title: NA
text: The PDGF receptor kinase inhibitor CGP57148B reversed the transformed phenotype and reduced the growth rate of COLIA1 / PDGFB - expressing cells but had no effects on control cells .

title: NA
text: The presence of dimeric COLIA1 / PDGFB precursors was demonstrated through PDGFB immunoprecipitations of metabolically labeled cells and also by PDGFB immunoprecipitations followed by immunoblotting with COLIA1 antibodies .

title: NA
text: Pulse - chase studies demonstrated that the COLIA1 / PDGFB precursor was processed to an end product that was indistinguishable from wild - type PDGF - BB .

title: NA
text: Finally , COLIA1 / PDGFB - expressing cells generated tumors after s .

title: NA
text: c c . injection into nude mice , and tumor growth was reduced by treatment with CGP57148B .

title: NA
text: We conclude that the COLIA1 / PDGFB fusion associated with DFSP contributes to tumor development through ectopic production of PDGF - BB and the formation of an autocrine loop .

title: NA
text: Our findings , thus , suggest that PDGF receptors could be a target for pharmacological treatment of DFSP and giant cell fibroblastoma , e . g . , through the use of PDGF receptor kinase inhibitors such as CGP57148B .

text: Identification of a common PEX1 mutation in Zellweger syndrome .

title: NA
text: The Zellweger spectrum of disease , encompassing Zellweger syndrome and the progressively milder phenotypes of neonatal adrenoleukodystrophy and infantile Refsum disease , is due to a failure to form functional peroxisomes .

title: NA
text: Cell fusion complementation studies demonstrated that these diseases are genetically heterogeneous , with two - thirds of all patients lying within a single complementation group , CG1 .

title: NA
text: Molecular genetic and cell biology studies have shown that PEX1 is deficient in many CG1 patients .

title: NA
text: However , previous studies have focused on mildly affected patients and there is still no report of two mutant PEX1 alleles in any Zellweger syndrome patient .

title: NA
text: Furthermore , mutations in the PMP70 gene have also been identified in two Zellweger syndrome patients from CG1 , raising the possibility that CG1 patients may represent a mixture of PEX1 - deficient and PMP70 - deficient individuals .

title: NA
text: To address the molecular basis of disease in Zellweger syndrome patients from CG1 , we examined all 24 PEX1 exons in four patients , including both patients that have mutations in PMP70 .

title: NA
text: PEX1 mutations were detected in all four patients , including a 1 - bp insertion ( c . 2097insT ) in exon 13 that was present in three of the four patients .

title: NA
text: Subsequent studies demonstrated that this mutation is present in one - half of all CG1 patients and correlates with the Zellweger syndrome phenotype .

title: NA
text: As this mutation leads to a loss of protein function its frequency makes it the most common cause of Zellweger syndrome , helping to explain the high percentage of patients that belong to CG1 .

text: Novel mutations in the Wiskott - Aldrich syndrome protein gene and their effects on transcriptional , translational , and clinical phenotypes .

title: NA
text: Wiskott - Aldrich syndrome ( WAS ) is an X - linked recessive immunodeficiency characterized by thrombocytopenia , eczema , and recurrent infections , and caused by mutations in the WAS protein ( WASP ) gene .

title: NA
text: WASP contains several functional domains through which it interacts with proteins involved in intracellular signaling and regulation of the actin cytoskeleton .

title: NA
text: In this report , 17 WASP gene mutations were identified , 12 of which are novel .

title: NA
text: DNA of affected males and obligate carriers was PCR amplified and analyzed by SSCA , heteroduplex analysis , and direct sequencing .

title: NA
text: The effects of the mutations at the mRNA and protein level were ascertained by RT - PCR and Western blot analyses .

title: NA
text: All missense mutations were located in exons 1 - 4 .

title: NA
text: Most of the nonsense , frameshift and splice site mutations were found in exons 6 - 11 .

title: NA
text: Mutations that alter splice sites led to the synthesis of several types of mRNAs , a fraction of which represented the normally spliced product .

title: NA
text: The presence of normally spliced transcripts was correlated with a milder phenotype .

title: NA
text: When one such case was studied by Western blotting , reduced amounts of normal - size WASP were present .

title: NA
text: In other cases as well , a correlation was found between the amount of normal or mutant WASP present and the phenotypes of the affected individuals .

title: NA
text: No protein was detected in two individuals with severe WAS .

title: NA
text: Reduced levels of a normal - size WASP with a missense mutation were seen in two individuals with XLT .

title: NA
text: It is concluded that mutation analysis at the DNA level is not sufficient for predicting clinical course .

title: NA
text: Studies at the transcript and protein level are needed for a better assessment . .

text: Aminoglycoside antibiotics restore dystrophin function to skeletal muscles of mdx mice .

title: NA
text: Duchenne muscular dystrophy ( DMD ) is caused by mutations in the dystrophin gene , leading to the absence of the dystrophin protein in striated muscle .

title: NA
text: A significant number of these mutations are premature stop codons .

title: NA
text: On the basis of the observation that aminoglycoside treatment can suppress stop codons in cultured cells , we tested the effect of gentamicin on cultured muscle cells from the mdx mouse - an animal model for DMD that possesses a premature stop codon in the dystrophin gene .

title: NA
text: Exposure of mdx myotubes to gentamicin led to the expression and localization of dystrophin to the cell membrane .

title: NA
text: We then evaluated the effects of differing dosages of gentamicin on expression and functional protection of the muscles of mdx mice .

title: NA
text: We identified a treatment regimen that resulted in the presence of dystrophin in the cell membrane in all striated muscles examined and that provided functional protection against muscular injury .

title: NA
text: To our knowledge , our results are the first to demonstrate that aminoglycosides can suppress stop codons not only in vitro but also in vivo .

title: NA
text: Furthermore , these results raise the possibility of a novel treatment regimen for muscular dystrophy and other diseases caused by premature stop codon mutations .

title: NA
text: This treatment could prove effective in up to 15 % of patients with DMD . .

text: Loss of the ataxia - telangiectasia gene product causes oxidative damage in target organs .

title: NA
text: Ataxia - telangiectasia ( A - T ) is characterized by a markedly increased sensitivity to ionizing radiation , increased incidence of cancer , and neurodegeneration , especially of the cerebellar Purkinje cells .

title: NA
text: Ionizing radiation oxidizes macromolecules and causes tissue damage through the generation of reactive oxygen species ( ROS ) .

title: NA
text: We therefore hypothesized that A - T is due to oxidative damage resulting from loss of function of the A - T gene product .

title: NA
text: To assess this hypothesis , we employed an animal model of A - T , the mouse with a disrupted Atm gene .

title: NA
text: We show that organs which develop pathologic changes in the Atm - deficient mice are targets of oxidative damage , and that cerebellar Purkinje cells are particularly affected .

title: NA
text: These observations provide a mechanistic basis for the A - T phenotype and lay a rational foundation for therapeutic intervention . .

text: Recessively inherited multiple epiphyseal dysplasia with normal stature , club foot , and double layered patella caused by a DTDST mutation .

title: NA
text: We have observed over 25 different mutations in the diastrophic dysplasia sulphate transporter gene ( DTDST ) in association with the recessive disorders achondrogenesis 1B , atelosteogenesis 2 , and diastrophic dysplasia .

title: NA
text: The c862t ( R279W ) transition is the most common mutation in non - Finnish patients , but in these disorders it is usually combined with other DTDST mutations .

title: NA
text: We had not seen a case of homozygosity for c862t ( R279W ) until we analysed DNA from a 36 year old male with tall - normal stature ( 180 cm ) who asked for genetic counselling for suspected multiple epiphyseal dysplasia .

title: NA
text: He was treated for club foot and hip dysplasia at birth .

title: NA
text: Skeletal changes consistent with multiple epiphyseal dysplasia , with the peculiar finding of a double layered patella , were recognised during childhood .

title: NA
text: Cleft palate , swelling of the ear pinna , and hitch hiker thumb were absent .

title: NA
text: He was found to be homozygous , and both healthy parents heterozygous , for the R279W mutation in DTDST , and his fibroblasts showed a sulphate incorporation defect typical of DTDST disorders .

title: NA
text: Counselling was given for a recessive disorder , thereby considerably reducing the probability of affected offspring .

title: NA
text: Multiple epiphyseal dysplasia is more frequently caused by dominant mutations in the COMP ( EDM1 , McKusick 132400 ) and COL9A2 genes ( EDM2 , McKusick 600204 ) .

title: NA
text: A few other patients and families with features similar to our proband have been described previously and considered to have autosomal recessive MED ( EDM4 , McKusick 226900 ) .

title: NA
text: This observation confirms the existence of this entity and assigns it to the phenotypic spectrum associated with mutations at the DTDST locus . .

text: Homozygosity for a novel DTDST mutation in a child with a ' broad bone - platyspondylic ' variant of diastrophic dysplasia .

title: NA
text: Atypical or variant forms of well - known chondrodysplasias may pose diagnostic problems .

title: NA
text: We report on a girl with clinical features suggesting diastrophic dysplasia but with unusual radiographic features including severe platyspondyly , wide metaphyses , and fibular overgrowth , which are partially reminiscent of metatropic dysplasia .

title: NA
text: The diagnosis was clarified by molecular analysis of the DTDST gene , which revealed homozygosity for a previously undescribed mutation leading to a Q454P substitution in the 10th transmembrane domain of the DTDST sulfate transporter .

title: NA
text: Molecular analysis may be of particular value in such atypical cases . .

text: The type of somatic mutation at APC in familial adenomatous polyposis is determined by the site of the germline mutation : a new facet to Knudson ' s ' two - hit ' hypothesis .

title: NA
text: APC is often cited as a prime example of a tumor suppressor gene .

title: NA
text: Truncating germline and somatic mutations ( or , infrequently , allelic loss ) occur in tumors in FAP ( familial adenomatous polyposis ) .

title: NA
text: Most sporadic colorectal cancers also have two APC mutations .

title: NA
text: Clues from attenuated polyposis , missense germline variants with mild disease and the somatic mutation cluster region ( codons 1 , 250 - 1 , 450 ) indicate , however , that APC mutations might not result in simple loss of protein function .

title: NA
text: We have found that FAP patients with germline APC mutations within a small region ( codons 1 , 194 - 1 , 392 at most ) mainly show allelic loss in their colorectal adenomas , in contrast to other FAP patients , whose second hits tend to occur by truncating mutations in the mutation cluster region .

title: NA
text: Our results indicate that different APC mutations provide cells with different selective advantages , with mutations close to codon 1 , 300 providing the greatest advantage .

title: NA
text: Allelic loss is selected strongly in cells with one mutation near codon 1 , 300 .

title: NA
text: A different germline - somatic APC mutation association exists in FAP desmoids .

title: NA
text: APC is not , therefore , a classical tumor suppressor .

title: NA
text: Our findings also indicate a new mechanism for disease severity if a broader spectrum of mutations is selected in tumors , the somatic mutation rate is effectively higher and more tumors grow . .

text: Mxi1 mutations in human neurofibrosarcomas .

title: NA
text: Mxi1 is thought to negatively regulate Myc function and may therefore be a potential tumor suppressor gene .

title: NA
text: Little effort has yet been made to find alterations involving this gene in human solid tumors .

title: NA
text: We screened 31 human gastric cancers , 7 esophageal cancers , 85 bone and soft tissue tumors of various types , including 4 neurofibrosarcomas .

title: NA
text: We also examined 29 human tumor cell lines consisting of 12 esophageal cancers , 7 glioma / glioblastomas and 10 others for Mxi1 mutations in exons 1 , 2 , 4 ( HLH domain ) , 5 and 6 .

title: NA
text: Polymerase chain reaction - single - strand conformation polymorphism ( PCR - SSCP ) and subsequent sequencing revealed three distinct polymorphisms in the intron - exon boundary upstream from exon 6 .

title: NA
text: We discovered a missense mutation , GCA to GTA ( Ala 54 Val ) , in exon 2 in a neurofibrosarcoma patient ( case 1 ) , two missense mutations , AAA to CAA ( Lys 118 Gln ) and GAA to GGA ( Glu 154 Gly ) in exon 5 of another neurofibrosarcoma patient ( case 2 ) , and 3 amino acid substitutions , GTG to GCG ( Val 179 Ala ) , GTT to GCT ( Val 181 Ala ) and TTC to CTC ( Phe 186 Leu ) , in a third neurofibrosarcoma patient ( case 3 ) .

title: NA
text: In case 3 , loss of heterozygosity was also demonstrated by informative ( TTC ) 3 / ( TTC ) 2 polymorphism .

title: NA
text: Our data demonstrate that mutations occur in the Mxi1 gene in neurofibrosarcoma .

title: NA
text: Missense mutations in the functional domain of Mxi1 in these cases may be involved in the pathogenesis of neurofibrosarcoma . .

text: A population - based study of the clinical expression of the hemochromatosis gene .

title: NA
text: BACKGROUND AND METHODS Hereditary hemochromatosis is associated with homozygosity for the C282Y mutation in the hemochromatosis ( HFE ) gene on chromosome 6 , elevated serum transferrin saturation , and excess iron deposits throughout the body .

title: NA
text: To assess the prevalence and clinical expression of the HFE gene , we conducted a population - based study in Busselton , Australia .

title: NA
text: In 1994 , we obtained blood samples for the determination of serum transferrin saturation and ferritin levels and the presence or absence of the C282Y mutation and the H63D mutation ( which may contribute to increased hepatic iron levels ) in 3011 unrelated white adults .

title: NA
text: We evaluated all subjects who had persistently elevated transferrin - saturation values ( 45 percent or higher ) or were homozygous for the C282Y mutation .

title: NA
text: We recommended liver biopsy for subjects with serum ferritin levels of 300 ng per milliliter or higher .

title: NA
text: The subjects were followed for up to four years .

title: NA
text: RESULTS Sixteen of the subjects ( 0 . 5 percent ) were homozygous for the C282Y mutation , and 424 ( 14 . 1 percent ) were heterozygous .

title: NA
text: The serum transferrin saturation was 45 percent or higher in 15 of the 16 who were homozygous ; in 1 subject it was 43 percent .

title: NA
text: Four of the homozygous subjects had previously been given a diagnosis of hemochromatosis , and 12 had not .

title: NA
text: Seven of these 12 patients had elevated serum ferritin levels in 1994 ; 6 of the 7 had further increases in 1998 , and 1 had a decrease , although the value remained elevated .

title: NA
text: The serum ferritin levels in the four other homozygous patients remained in the normal range .

title: NA
text: Eleven of the 16 homozygous subjects underwent liver biopsy ; 3 had hepatic fibrosis , and 1 , who had a history of excessive alcohol consumption , had cirrhosis and mild microvesicular steatosis .

title: NA
text: Eight of the 16 homozygous subjects had clinical findings that were consistent with the presence of hereditary hemochromatosis , such as hepatomegaly , skin pigmentation , and arthritis .

title: NA
text: This can be problematic when only part of the gene is examined or when relevant DNA alterations are not recognized by standard methods .

text: We present a child in whom phenylketonuria was apparently caused by homozygosity for the mutation E390G in exon 11 of the phenylalanine hydroxylase ( PAH ) gene .

text: However , the clinical severity of the disease was not quite as mild as expected , the mutation was not identified in the father despite confirmed paternity , and the paternal allele showed a highly unusual pattern of polymorphic markers in the PAH gene .

title: NA
text: Presence of a large deletion involving exons 9 , 10 and 11 of the phenylalanine hydroxylase gene was confirmed by long - range PCR .

title: NA
text: Diagnostic DNA analyses should include a comprehensive examination of the whole relevant gene in the patient and confirmation of carrier status in both parents . .

text: Early onset of X - linked Emery - Dreifuss muscular dystrophy in a boy with emerin gene deletion .

title: NA
text: A boy developed contractures of the Achilles tendons at 3 years and of the postcervical muscles at 7 years , although neither contractures of the elbows nor cardiac abnormality were recognized by the age of 9 years .

title: NA
text: Muscle computed tomography scanning revealed changes characteristic of muscle involvement .

title: NA
text: Emerin was not detected in the biopsied muscle , and RT - PCR and PCR - based genomic DNA analyses of the emerin gene demonstrated no amplification product in the patient .

title: NA
text: These results confirmed the diagnosis of X - linked Emery - Dreifuss muscular dystrophy ( EDMD ) , and reinforce the necessity of molecular genetic diagnosis of the membrane protein emerin in younger patients with possible EDMD before appearance of the typical symptoms , to avoid sudden cardiac death . .

text: Duchenne / Becker muscular dystrophy : correlation of phenotype by electroretinography with sites of dystrophin mutations .

title: NA
text: The dark - adapted electroretinogram ( ERG ) of patients with Duchenne and Becker muscular dystrophy ( DMD / BMD ) shows a marked reduction in b - wave amplitude .

title: NA
text: Genotype - phenotype studies of mouse models for DMD show position - specific effects of the mutations upon the phenotype mice with 5 defects of dystrophin have normal ERGs , those with defects in the central region have a normal b - wave amplitude associated with prolonged implicit times for both the b - wave and oscillatory potentials , and mice with 3 defects have a phenotype similar to that seen in DMD / BMD patients .

title: NA
text: The mouse studies suggest a key role for the carboxyl terminal dystrophin isoform , Dp260 , in retinal electrophysiology .

title: NA
text: We have undertaken a systematic evaluation of DMD / BMD patients through clinical examination and review of the literature in order to determine whether the position - specific effects of mutations noted in the mouse are present in man .

title: NA
text: We have found that , in man , a wider variation of DMD defects correlate with reductions in the b - wave amplitude .

title: NA
text: Individuals with normal ERGs have mutations predominantly located 5 of the transcript initiation site of Dp260 .

title: NA
text: Our results suggest that the most important determinant in the ERG b - wave phenotype is the mutation position , rather than muscle disease severity .

title: NA
text: Forty - six per cent of patients with mutations 5 of the Dp260 transcript start site have abnormal ERGs , as opposed to 94 % with more distal mutations .

title: NA
text: The human genotype - phenotype correlations are consistent with a role for Dp260 in normal retinal electrophysiology and may also reflect the expression of other C - terminal dystrophin isoforms and their contributions to retinal signal transmission . .

text: Cis and trans effects of the myotonic dystrophy ( DM ) mutation in a cell culture model .

title: NA
text: The mutation causing myotonic dystrophy ( DM ) has been identified as a CTG expansion in the 3 - untranslated region ( 3 - UTR ) of the DM protein kinase gene ( DMPK ) , but the mechanism ( s ) of pathogenesis remain unknown .

title: NA
text: Studies using DM patient materials have often produced confusing results .

title: NA
text: Therefore , to study the effects of the DM mutation in a controlled environment , we have established a cell culture model system using C2C12 mouse myoblasts .

title: NA
text: By expressing chimeric reporter constructs containing a reporter gene fused to a human DMPK 3 - UTR , we identified both cis and trans effects that are mediated by the DM mutation .

title: NA
text: Our data show that a mutant DMPK 3 - UTR , with as few as 57 CTGs , had a negative cis effect on protein expression and resulted in the aggregation of reporter transcripts into discrete nuclear foci .

title: NA
text: We determined by deletion analysis that an expanded ( CTG ) ( n ) tract alone was sufficient to mediate these cis effects .

title: NA
text: Furthermore , in contrast to the normal DMPK 3 - UTR mRNA , a mutant DMPK 3 - UTR mRNA with ( CUG ) ( 200 ) selectively inhibited myogenic differentiation of C2C12 myoblasts .

title: NA
text: Genetic analysis and the Cre - loxP system were used to clearly demonstrate that the myoblast fusion defect could be rescued by eliminating the expression of the mutant DMPK 3 - UTR transcript .

title: NA
text: Characterization of spontaneous deletion events mapped the inhibitory effect to the ( CTG ) ( n ) expansion and / or the 3 end of the DMPK 3 - UTR .

title: NA
text: These results provide evidence that the DM mutation acts in cis to reduce protein production ( consistent with DMPK haploinsufficiency ) and in trans as a riboregulator to inhibit myogenesis . .

text: Coats ' disease of the retina ( unilateral retinal telangiectasis ) caused by somatic mutation in the NDP gene : a role for norrin in retinal angiogenesis .

title: NA
text: Coats disease is characterized by abnormal retinal vascular development ( so - called retinal telangiectasis ) which results in massive intraretinal and subretinal lipid accumulation ( exudative retinal detachment ) .

title: NA
text: The classical form of Coats disease is almost invariably isolated , unilateral and seen in males .

title: NA
text: A female with a unilateral variant of Coats disease gave birth to a son affected by Norrie disease .

title: NA
text: Both carried a missense mutation within the NDP gene on chromosome Xp11 .

title: NA
text: Subsequently analysis of the retinas of nine enucleated eyes from males with Coats disease demonstrated in one a somatic mutation in the NDP gene which was not present within non - retinal tissue .

title: NA
text: We suggest that Coats telangiectasis is secondary to somatic mutation in the NDP gene which results in a deficiency of norrin ( the protein product of the NDP gene ) within the developing retina .

title: NA
text: This supports recent observations that the protein is critical for normal retinal vasculogenesis .

text: Hereditary TP53 codon 292 and somatic P16INK4A codon 94 mutations in a Li - Fraumeni syndrome family .

title: NA
text: Li - Fraumeni syndrome is an autosomal dominant disorder that is characterized by various types of cancer in childhood and adult cases .

title: NA
text: Although hereditary TP53 mutation is very rare in different human cancers , it has been frequently reported in Li - Fraumeni syndrome .

title: NA
text: On the other hand , hereditary mutations of TP57KIP2 , P15INK4B , and P16INK4A , which affect the cell cycle similar to TP53 , were observed in some types of cancer .

title: NA
text: In a Turkish family with the diagnosis of Li - Fraumeni syndrome , we analyzed the mutation pattern of TP53 , P57KIP2 , P15INK4B , and P16INK4A in the peripheral blood , and loss of heterozygosity ( homo / hemizygous deletion ) pattern of TP53 and P15INK4B / P16INK4A in two tumor tissues .

title: NA
text: The propositus had a seminoma , his daughter a medulloblastoma , and one of his healthy cousins , a TP53 codon 292 missense point mutation ( AAA - - > ATA ; Lys - - > Ile ) in the peripheral blood cells .

title: NA
text: Tumor tissue obtained from the propositus with the seminoma revealed loss of heterozygosity in the TP53 gene .

title: NA
text: In the analyses of tumor tissues from the propositus and his daughter , a P16INK4A codon 94 missense point mutation ( GCG - - > GAG ; Ala - - > Glu ) was observed with the hereditary TP53 mutation .

title: NA
text: P16INK4A codon 94 mutation observed in our family is a novel mutation in Li - Fraumeni syndrome .

title: NA
text: No other gene alteration in TP53 , P57KIP2 , P15INK4B , and P16INK4A was observed .

title: NA
text: Existence of the P16INK4A mutation and the hereditary TP53 mutation with or without loss of heterozygosity in the TP53 gene ( seminoma / medulloblastoma ) may be evidence for a common mechanism involved in tumorogenesis .

title: NA
text: The gene alterations in TP53 and P16INK4A genes may be used as tumor markers in our family . .

text: A novel mutation in the sodium / iodide symporter gene in the largest family with iodide transport defect .

title: NA
text: We previously reported nine children with an autosomally recessive form of congenital hypothyroidism due to an iodide transport defect in a large Hutterite family with extensive consanguinity living in central Canada .

title: NA
text: Since the original report , we have diagnosed congenital hypothyroidism by newborn TSH screening in 9 additional children from the family .

title: NA
text: We performed direct sequencing of the PCR products of each NIS ( sodium / iodide symporter ) gene exon with flanking introns amplified from genomic DNA extracted from peripheral blood cells of the patients .

title: NA
text: We identified a novel NIS gene mutation , G395R ( Gly395 - - > Arg ; GGA - - > AGA ) , in 10 patients examined in the present study .

title: NA
text: All of the parents tested were heterozygous for the mutation , suggesting that the patients were homozygous .

title: NA
text: The mutation was located in the 10th transmembrane helix .

title: NA
text: Expression experiments by transfection of the mutant NIS complimentary DNA into COS - 7 cells showed no perchlorate - sensitive iodide uptake , confirming that the mutation is the direct cause of the iodide transport defect in these patients .

title: NA
text: A patient who showed an intermediate saliva / serum technetium ratio ( 14 . 0 ; normal , > or = 20 ) and was considered to have a partial or less severe defect in the previous report ( IX - 24 ) did not have a NIS gene mutation .

title: NA
text: It is now possible to use gene diagnostics of this unique NIS mutation to identify patients with congenital hypothyroidism due to an iodide transport defect in this family and to determine the carrier state of potential parents for genetic counseling and arranging rapid and early diagnosis of their infants .

text: Molecular analysis in familial neurohypophyseal diabetes insipidus : early diagnosis of an asymptomatic carrier .

title: NA
text: Familial neurohypophyseal diabetes insipidus ( FNDI ) is an inherited deficiency of the hormone arginine vasopressin ( AVP ) and is transmitted as an autosomal dominant trait .

title: NA
text: In the present study we have analyzed the AVP - neurophysin II ( AVP - NPII ) gene in a Spanish kindred .

title: NA
text: Studies were performed on seven members ( four clinically affected ) of the family .

title: NA
text: Patients were diagnosed at the Hospital Universitario Gregorio Maranon ( Madrid , Spain ) .

title: NA
text: The entire coding region of the AVP - NPII gene of all family members was amplified by PCR and sequenced .

title: NA
text: All affected individuals presented a missense mutation ( G1757 - - > A ) that replaces glycine at position 23 with arginine within the NPII domain .

title: NA
text: The substitution was confirmed by restriction endonuclease analysis and was present in heterozygosis .

title: NA
text: Additionally , one of the asymptomatic relatives ( a girl 8 months old at the time of study ) was identified as carrier of the same mutation and developed the disease 3 months later .

title: NA
text: The alteration found in the second exon of the gene in this family seems to be responsible for the disease , as all individuals harboring the mutation had been previously diagnosed or have eventually developed FNDI .

title: NA
text: Identification of the molecular defect underlying FNDI in affected families is a powerful tool for early asymptomatic diagnosis in infants . .

text: Deficit of in vivo mitochondrial ATP production in patients with Friedreich ataxia .

title: NA
text: Friedreich ataxia ( FRDA ) , the most common of the inherited ataxias , is an autosomal recessive degenerative disorder , characterized clinically by onset before the age of 25 of progressive gait and limb ataxia , absence of deep tendon reflexes , extensor plantar responses , and loss of position and vibration sense in the lower limbs .

title: NA
text: FRDA is caused by a GAA triplet expansion in the first intron of the FRDA gene on chromosome 9q13 in 97 % of patients .

title: NA
text: The FRDA gene encodes a widely expressed 210 - aa protein , frataxin , which is located in mitochondria and is severely reduced in FRDA patients .

title: NA
text: Frataxin function is still unknown but the knockout of the yeast frataxin homologue gene ( YFH1 ) showed a severe defect of mitochondrial respiration and loss of mtDNA associated with elevated intramitochondrial iron .

title: NA
text: Here we report in vivo evidence of impaired mitochondrial respiration in skeletal muscle of FRDA patients .

title: NA
text: Using phosphorus magnetic resonance spectroscopy we demonstrated a maximum rate of muscle mitochondrial ATP production ( V ( max ) ) below the normal range in all 12 FRDA patients and a strong negative correlation between mitochondrial V ( max ) and the number of GAA repeats in the smaller allele .

title: NA
text: Our results show that FRDA is a nuclear - encoded mitochondrial disorder affecting oxidative phosphorylation and give a rationale for treatments aimed to improve mitochondrial function in this condition . .

text: Identification of a novel R21X mutation in the liver - type arginase gene ( ARG1 ) in four Portuguese patients with argininemia .

title: NA
text: Argininemia is a rare autossomal recessive disorder caused by deficiency in the cytosolic liver - type arginase enzyme ( L - arginine urea - hydrolase ; E . C . 3 . 5 . 3 . 1 ) .

title: NA
text: In order to investigate the molecular basis for argininemia in four unrelated Portuguese patients ( two from northern Portugal and two from Madeira Island ) we performed a DNA sequence analysis of all the exons and exon / intron boundaries of the liver - type arginase gene ( ARG1 ) .

title: NA
text: All patients were found to be homozygous for a newly identified C - > T transition in codon 21 ( exon 2 ) substituting arginine for a premature stop codon ( R21X CGA to TGA ) and generating a NlaIII restriction site .

title: NA
text: Restriction digestion following PCR amplification of ARG1 exon 2 confirmed the presence of the mutation .

text: Mutation of the sterol 27 - hydroxylase gene ( CYP27 ) results in truncation of mRNA expressed in leucocytes in a Japanese family with cerebrotendinous xanthomatosis .

title: NA
text: OBJECTIVES A Japanese family with cerebrotendinous xanthomatosis ( CTX ) was investigated for a sequence alteration in the sterol 27 - hydroxylase gene ( CYP27 ) .

title: NA
text: The expression of CYP27 has been mostly explored using cultured fibroblasts , prompting the examination of the transcripts from blood leucocytes as a simple and rapid technique .

title: NA
text: METHODS An alteration in CYP27 of the proband was searched for by polymerase chain reaction - single strand conformation polymorphism ( PCR - SSCP ) analysis and subsequent sequencing .

title: NA
text: Samples of RNA were subjected to reverse transcription PCR ( RT - PCR ) and the product of the proband was amplified with nested primers and sequenced .

title: NA
text: RESULTS A homozygous G to A transition at the 5 end of intron 7 was detected in the patient .

title: NA
text: In RT - PCR analysis , only a truncated transcript was detected in the patient , whereas both normal and truncated transcripts were detected in the siblings .

title: NA
text: The sequencing of the patients cDNA fragment disclosed a direct conjuction of exon 6 and exon 8 .

title: NA
text: CONCLUSION The mutation at splice donor site and the truncation of mRNA were identical with those of a recently reported Italian patient , although different in symptomatology .

title: NA
text: The application of blood leucocytes can be a simple technique on analysing a constructive abnormality of CYP27 mRNA . .

text: Clinical and molecular genetic analysis of 19 Wolfram syndrome kindreds demonstrating a wide spectrum of mutations in WFS1 .

title: NA
text: Wolfram syndrome is an autosomal recessive neurodegenerative disorder characterized by juvenile - onset diabetes mellitus and progressive optic atrophy .

title: NA
text: mtDNA deletions have been described , and a gene ( WFS1 ) recently has been identified , on chromosome 4p16 , encoding a predicted 890 amino acid transmembrane protein .

title: NA
text: Direct DNA sequencing was done to screen the entire coding region of the WFS1 gene in 30 patients from 19 British kindreds with Wolfram syndrome .

title: NA
text: DNA was also screened for structural rearrangements ( deletions and duplications ) and point mutations in mtDNA .

title: NA
text: No pathogenic mtDNA mutations were found in our cohort .

title: NA
text: We identified 24 mutations in the WFS1 gene 8 nonsense mutations , 8 missense mutations , 3 in - frame deletions , 1 in - frame insertion , and 4 frameshift mutations .

title: NA
text: Of these , 23 were novel mutations , and most occurred in exon 8 .

title: NA
text: The majority of patients were compound heterozygotes for two mutations , and there was no common founder mutation .

title: NA
text: The data were also analyzed for genotype - phenotype relationships .

title: NA
text: Although some interesting cases were noted , consideration of the small sample size and frequency of each mutation indicated no clear - cut correlations between any of the observed mutations and disease severity .

title: NA
text: There were no obvious mutation hot spots or clusters .

title: NA
text: Hence , molecular screening for Wolfram syndrome in affected families and for Wolfram syndrome - carrier status in subjects with psychiatric disorders or diabetes mellitus will require complete analysis of exon 8 and upstream exons . .

text: A highly accurate , low cost test for BRCA1 mutations .

title: NA
text: The hereditary breast and ovarian cancer syndrome is associated with a high frequency of BRCA1 mutations .

title: NA
text: However , the widespread use of BRCA1 testing has been limited to date by three principal concerns the fear of loss of health and life insurance , the uncertain clinical value of a positive test result , and the current lack of an inexpensive and sensitive screening test for BRCA1 mutations .

title: NA
text: We have developed an inexpensive system for gene mutational scanning , based on a combination of extensive multiplex PCR amplification and two dimensional electrophoresis .

title: NA
text: The efficiency of this system , as a screening test for BRCA1 mutations , was evaluated in a panel of 60 samples from high risk women , 14 of which contained a previously identified mutation in BRCA1 .

title: NA
text: All 14 mutations were identified , as well as an additional five that had previously escaped detection .

title: NA
text: In addition to the 19 mutations , a total of 15 different polymorphic variants were scored , most of which were recurring .

title: NA
text: All were confirmed by nucleotide sequencing .

title: NA
text: The cost of screening per sample was calculated to be approximately US $ 70 for the manual technique used in this study , and may be reduced to approximately US $ 10 with the introduction of commercially available PCR robotics and fluorescent imaging .

title: NA
text: Implementation of this method of mutation screening in the research and clinical setting should permit rapid accrual of quantitative data on genotype - phenotype associations for the evaluation of diagnostic testing . .

title: NA
text: We report on a boy with a maternal uniparental disomy for chromosome 14 ( UPD ( 14 ) ) .

title: NA
text: At 7 years of age he was referred to us by the paediatrician because of symptoms of Prader - Willi syndrome ( PWS ) .

title: NA
text: He showed short stature , obesity , mild developmental delay , cryptorchidism , and some mild dysmorphic features .
